item.description:
Some investors are making serious bank AND helping the environment at the same time.

How?

By 'Going Green' with their properties and making strategic changes, taking advantage of little-known subsidies and increasing their property values.

Join us for our June 4th Turning the Key networking event where we'll have our ForeclosuresMass Green Team of local environmentally conscious investors and developers presenting what they're doing to make green by going green.

Steve Tise is a practical type architect who excels at user friendly designs while incorporating energy efficiency. He has designed a ton of affordable and market rate housing products throughout the U.S. and the Caribbean. He is also a well sought-after design consultant assisting a number of Housing Authorities nationwide.

John Winslow, a top tier architect focused on the renewable energy and green resources as a trade, is also a sought after design specialist in both affordable housing and market rate properties.

In addition to live Q&A, our panel will be covering:
  • Which improvements can MAKE money vs. COST money
  • Government subsidies to help with the costs of conversions (including Weatherization Funds, Energy Rebates, Retrofit Grants and Green Building funds)
  • Hot topics such as LEED AP Certification, LEED Building, Solar PV products, and Geotherm
  • How to determine which changes to make first
  • What environmentally friendly changes have the biggest impact
  • Short term vs. long term gains by going green.


Panel's are always our most popular events, so make sure to reserve your spot early by pre-registering online.

group.name: Real Estate Networking/Education Meeting in Boston

item.name: TTK: How Investors are Making Green by Going Green
